condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: Increased capacity of Government institutions to plan, implement and monitor child-focused outcome-based budgeting

description.narrative: UNICEF's social policy engagements have contributed to the emergence of increased commitment to addressing the needs of the most vulnerable children and families during the COVID19 crisis. Following on from UNICEF engagements, national policy responses to the COVID19 have included strengthened social assistance for low income single parents and people with disabilities and increased public assistance towards childcare costs for low income families. UNICEF is also supporting the government to revise the National Child Policy and associated Action Plan, thus providing an opportunity for increased policy focus on building back better for children. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Evidence and recommendations from research and analysis on child poverty and child-sensitive social protection feeds into key national policies, strategy papers and plans
Local governments (incl. municipalities) with development plans that include specific activities that address the needs and priorities of children, including the most vulnerable and marginalized.
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) National budgetary frameworks that address child poverty and disparities
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Governemnt budget allocations to sectoral or child-focused policies and programs as percentage of total government budget allocations
